newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Ansett plans briefing, sees flat group result.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Ansett plans briefing, sees flat group result.

text.p: Carrier Ansett Australia said on Thursday it expected a break even result for the Ansett group in the year ending June 30, 1997.
Ansett said it expected to make an announcement about an alliance with other airlines on Friday.
In a statement, Ansett said it would hold a joint media briefing with Air New Zealand and Singapore Airlines on Friday at 10.45 a.m. (0045 GMT) in Melbourne.
"The consolidated Ansett group is talking about break even," general manager, international, of Ansett Australia Craig Wallace told reporters.

Wallace said the break even result followed a similar performance in 1995/96 and represented the foundation for the Ansett group's goal of driving profitability to acceptable levels within three years.
"What it is doing is setting the base," Wallace said.
He cited Ansett executive chairman Rod Eddington's goal of achieving acceptable returns on investment over three years and making major changes to put the airline on a sound footing.
Media reports this week said Singapore Airlines Ltd is in talks to become an equal partner with News Corp Ltd and Air New Zealand Ltd in Ansett Holdings Ltd.
